Package kalix.springsdk.annotations

Annotation Type Subscribe.ValueEntity

Enclosing class:
Subscribe
@Target({TYPE,METHOD}) @Retention(RUNTIME) @Documented public static @interface Subscribe.ValueEntity
Annotation for subscribing to updates from a Value Entity. It can be used both at type and method levels. When used at type level, it means the `View` will not be transforming state. When used at method level, it gives the ability to transform the updates into a different state for the view or delete the view state (handleDeletes flag).

  • Required Element Summary

    Required Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Required Element
    Description
    Class<? extends kalix.javasdk.valueentity.ValueEntity<?>>
    value
    Assign the class type of the entity one intends to subscribe to, which must extend ValueEntity.

  • Optional Element Summary

    Optional Elements
    Modifier and Type
    Optional Element
    Description
    boolean
    handleDeletes
    When true at type level the subscription will automatically delete the view state based on ValueEntity deletion fact.

  • Element Details

    • value

      Class<? extends kalix.javasdk.valueentity.ValueEntity<?>> value
      Assign the class type of the entity one intends to subscribe to, which must extend ValueEntity.

    • handleDeletes

      boolean handleDeletes
      When true at type level the subscription will automatically delete the view state based on ValueEntity deletion fact. When true at method level it allows to create a special handler for deletes (must be declared to receive zero parameters): 
      {@code
 @Subscribe.ValueEntity(MyValueEntity.class)
 public UpdateEffect<MyView> onChange(ValueEntity valueEntity) {
   return effects().updateState(...);
 }

 @Subscribe.ValueEntity(value = MyValueEntity.class, handleDeletes = true)
 public UpdateEffect<MyView> onDelete() {
   return effects().deleteState();
 }
 </pre>
      Default:
      false
